summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of East Pike Street, from Thirty-seventh Avenue to Eighth-eighth Avenue; Thirty-eighth Avenue, from East Pike Street to East Union Street; East Union Street, from Thirty-seventh Avenue to Thirty-eighth Avenue; Grand Way and Grand Avenue, from Thirty-eighth Avenue to Newport Avenue; Newport Avenue, from Grand Avenue to Hugo Place; and Hugo Place, from Newport Avenue to Lakeside Avenue, all in the City of Seattle, by grading and curbing the same, in accordance with Resolution No. 293 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
